title: How to download music albums - Quora

response.answer_text: Below are 3 top music download websites: 1. SoundCloud is one of the popular music sites that lets you stream unlimited music and download songs for free. 2. YouTube is one of the largest sites on the internet offering unlimited video and music streaming; it has almost all kinds of music in it. 3. Last. fm with their excellent music recommendation system. You can see the list of downloadable songs from through the “Free Music Downloads” link present at the bottom of the page You may say these websites may not allow you to download you all music albums you would like. But you can use online downloaders. If you would like to download SoundCloud and YouTube music for free, I’d recommend SaveFrom. Using it you can save all tracks from the albums you want to download, copying their URLs and pasting into SF website.

you can visit many of the sites that allow you to download music, but if you want it for free, without having to visit a lot of websites , type this: indexof: name of the song or album (of your choice) this is how it looks, once you have chosen a link

I think streaming is far better than downloading. Use cloud services like Wynk, Spotify, Apple Music, Gaana, Saavn, Play Music etc., which gives you purest music without any interruptions. Many of these also provides offline option. So, I think it fulfills your need. :-) Thank you.

The best way is obviously with streaming services like spotify and apple music, since illegal activities shouldn’t be promoted here (or anywhere). They all let you sync the music to your devices and in the case of Apple Music, you can mix you own mp3s with their music on your playlists. AND they have a long free intro period and a great student discount.
You can download them from torrents and everywhere but I would recommend you to buy the albums and support the artists! You can buy them easily on iTunes, Spotify and other places :) So be wise!

Visit your retailer of choice’s website, pay up (credit or debit card) and you’ll get a link to the files in whatever choice of format you made. Itunes does it automatically if you have it installed, Amazon’s Music app likewise (though I’m not fond of it - didn’t work with Windows 10 last time I tried it).
